content.webTitle: Ireland: Declan Ganley rejoins campaign for Lisbon Treaty 'no' vote

fields.headline: Ireland: Declan Ganley rejoins campaign for Lisbon Treaty 'no' vote
fields.bodyText: The multimillionaire Eurosceptic and Libertas founder Declan Ganley, today re-entered the Irish Lisbon EU referendum campaign claiming there was an "astonishing degree of misrepresentation" of the treaty. Ganley's late entry to the debate will boost the campaign for a no vote against Ireland ratifying the EU reform programme. An opinion poll published today in Dublin showed support for a yes vote in next month's referendum was increasing. The Sunday Business Post/Red C poll found 62% intended to vote yes, with 23% voting no and 15% remaining undecided.
